newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks end sharply up on bargain-hunting.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks end sharply up on bargain-hunting.

text.p: Taiwan share prices closed sharply higher on Saturday as investors hunted for bargains following Friday's tumble, brokers said.
The weighted index shrugged off early-session malaise to finish 127.67 points or 1.56 percent higher at 8,314.67.
Turnover was an active T$93.2 billion.
The index, hit by concerns that the shares were overvalued, had plunged by 298.66 points or 3.52 percent on Friday.
"Friday's plunge was huge, and naturally some people took the opportunity to buy lower-priced stocks today (Saturday)," said Allen Huang, analyst for National Securities.
Brokers, however, said the market would remain in a downward consolidation despite Saturday's rebound.
"One session of gains would not change the overall trend, because the rise was merely a technical one," the National's Huang said.

Electronic shares led Saturday's session by rising 3.04 percent. Both Inventec Corp and Microtek International soaring by the daily seven-percent limit or T$21 and T$5.50 respectively to T$322 and T$86.
The heavily weighted financial sector rose 1.12 percent.
Taiwan's stock market had been one of the world's hottest performers in 1997. The index had risen 27 percent this year before dropping in a downward correction on April 28.
A 8,250-8,350 range was seen for Monday.
